newsitem.title: USA: Homestake Mining to buy Snata Fe Pacific Gold.
newsitem.headline: Homestake Mining to buy Snata Fe Pacific Gold.

text.p: Homestake Mining reached an agreement to buy Santa Fe Pacific Gold for $17.42 a share or $2.3 billion, the companies said Monday.
The pact would create the second largest gold producer in North America, a statement issued by the companies said.
The transaction will be accounted for as a pooling of interests and is expected to be tax free.
The acquisition will be accretive to Homestake's expected 1997 cash flow and earnings before one-time transaction costs, the statement said.
Patrick James, chairman, president and chief executive officer of Santa Fe, will become Homestake's president and chief operating officer, the statement said.

The agreement was signed three days after Newmont Mining Corp disclosed an unsolocited stock offer for Santa Fe that was valued at roughly 12.5 percent less that Homestake's, The Wall Street Journal reported Monday.
